channel.title: World at One: BBC Radio 4 News
channel.description: Forty five minutes of news, analysis and comment with Martha Kearney and Shaun Ley

item.title: WATO: Thursday 18th of April 2013
item.description: In his first broadcast interview since starting the job, we speak to the Government’s Chief Scientific Adviser; Police in Texas fear up to 15 people have died in an explosion at a fertilizer factory; Arrest order for Pervez Musharraf
item.itunes:subtitle: In his first broadcast interview since starting the job, we speak to the Government’s Chief Scientific Adviser; Police in Texas fear up to 15 people have died in an explosion at a fertilizer factory; Arrest order for Pervez Musharraf...

item.title: WATO: Wednesday 17 April 2013
item.description: On World at One, coverage of Lady Thatcher's funeral and reflections on her legacy from the Mayor of London, Boris Johnson
item.itunes:subtitle: On World at One, coverage of Lady Thatcher's funeral and reflections on her legacy from the Mayor of London, Boris Johnson...
item.itunes:summary: On World at One, coverage of Lady Thatcher's funeral and reflections on her legacy from the Mayor of London, Boris Johnson
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: Boston marathon explosions kill three
item.description: Three people have been killed and more than 150 injured in the explosions at the Boston marathon. A witness who was at the scene shortly after the attack tells us about a young boy who was killed after seeing his father compete in the race.
item.itunes:subtitle: Three people have been killed and more than 150 injured in the explosions at the Boston marathon. A witness who was at the scene shortly after the attack tells us about a young boy who was killed after seeing his father compete in the race....
item.itunes:summary: Three people have been killed and more than 150 injured in the explosions at the Boston marathon. A witness who was at the scene shortly after the attack tells us about a young boy who was killed after seeing his father compete in the race.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: WATO: Afghan Opium Boom
item.description: Afghanistan's farmers increase opium production, says UN; North Korea marks anniversary of founding father's birth; and Should owners of expensive properties in southern Europe be taxed to help pay for future Eurozone bailouts?
item.itunes:subtitle: Afghanistan's farmers increase opium production, says UN; North Korea marks anniversary of founding father's birth; and Should owners of expensive properties in southern Europe be taxed to help pay for future Eurozone bailouts?...
item.itunes:summary: Afghanistan's farmers increase opium production, says UN; North Korea marks anniversary of founding father's birth; and Should owners of expensive properties in southern Europe be taxed to help pay for future Eurozone bailouts?
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: Cyprus in new bailout plea
item.description: Cypriot President writes to EU leaders to ask for more help, we hear from Nicosia, Dublin and Berlin; the latest row over the future of Leeds General Infirmary's child cardiac unit; and Former Radio 1 DJ on the Ding Dong Thatcher storm.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cypriot President writes to EU leaders to ask for more help, we hear from Nicosia, Dublin and Berlin; the latest row over the future of Leeds General Infirmary's child cardiac unit; and Former Radio 1 DJ on the Ding Dong Thatcher storm....
